title: deadbeef support

Had to build from source for it to work with Fedora 22. The best app on the Play Store!

title: I love it!
comment: Makes KDE a nice place to be..  App seems modular so maybe texting from KDE in the future? *Hint hint*

title: Perfect
comment: Does exactly what it says it does, and it does it well.
Works, mostly

title: Super cool
comment: Works amazing well. Love this application!

Awesome application, But i seem to have some desync issues where the PC thinks its paired and connected to phone (taskbar in KDE shows messages from phone) but the phone tells me its not connected even though its on the same wifi etc. (pings dont work for example)   A Feature request would be to stream audio between PC and Phone would be really nice =)

I'm running Kubuntu 14.04 and added the mentioned PPA, updated and installed on the desktop side and on my Samsung S4.  The machines connected and I could ping.  Remote mouse control didn't work at all.  Multimedia didn't recognize my default player etc.. There's so many positive reviews I can only think that it might be my setup.  I run dual monitors which may be giving the app some hic-ups.    Next up is to try with my laptop and a single monitor.
First app of its kind that just works perfectly! Multimedia controls, mouse/keyboard input, all great!! :)

title: Great just a few things
comment: First my computer cant access the files on my external SD card on my phone (Samsung Galaxy S4). Second i would like the option to connect my phone via USB since I dont have wifi access all the time and this app makes kubuntu amazing since i can control it as if it were a remote but if wifi isn't available i would love an alternative way to connect my device to my laptop.

title: 1 Problem
comment: New Linux user here. Currently using eOS. When trying to browse device the folder is empty. Everything else works OK.

title: Finally its here.
comment: I have S5 Android 4.4 and this app works on my Ubuntu 15.04  Transferring files are very easy and 100 times faster then Bluetooth 4.0. Transfer files from and to mobile phone. I use the clipboard copy feature heavily.  I use it on my workstation, desktop and laptop and so far no crashes or failures.   Good job KDE I am very satisfied. I am so proud of this app. Thanks for the repo ppa developer.

title: Outstanding app

title: Very handy

The funcionality is really neat, the app allows you to watch movies on a big screen without the need to stand up from your couch thanks to the remote function. If you use headphones and love loud music, incoming calls notifications really come in handy. There are many uses to this app. Plus, its perfomance is good - no crashes on my old 4.2 so far.

comment: Kubuntu 14.10, OnePlus phone. Works as advertised.

title: Text message notifications!
comment: Don't miss a text message ever again because you're hard at work and you left your phone charging on the desk.  Plus you can use your phone's touchscreen as a trackpad for your computer's mouse cursor.

title: Just about perfect
comment: I've been looking for an app like this for months. I just switched to Plasma 5 from GNOME, and I stumbled on this. Exceeds my expectations. Only issue I have once in a while is that the tray icon doesn't reflect that the app is connected. Removing it from the tray and adding it again fixes this.

title: Works great on KDE!
comment: I  run Kubuntu Linux and installed the version from the ppa after initially installing it from the Kubuntu repositories All functions worked as expected--even the keyboard.  The repository version did not have keyboard functionality.
Awesome application
Great app, however I can't use it because it's not been updated to support kf5 yet. Hopefully support will come soon.

title: Rocking
comment: Works like bomb for me! Love it.

title: Love KDE and Plasma 5.3

title: A must have for KDE users

comment: Make your life easy with KDE.

Everything seems to work well except for the keyboard function, using 3rd party SwiftKey keyboard. I'm also running the latest Linux Mint Cinnamon using KDE Connect Indicator.

title: Fantastic!
comment: This is so useful, I can hardly imagine not having it! The shared clipboard is a godsend, I use it all the time.  As for improvements, maybe you could make setup easier, it wasn't clear that I had to open a port in my firewall. Also, some sort of indication when a device is connected to the pc would be useful, a notification/tray icon maybe? At least something in the kde settings pane... This app makes my proprietary-using friends jealous ;)

title: Nice
comment: It absolutely works with lollipop 🍭

title: Yes!
comment: Finally, an app with true functionality! There is only one thing missing for me. I would love to have a volume control for my system sound settings of my Linux machine.

title: Great application, useful every day.
comment: Very handy in muting my music stream during phone calls. Remotely controlling music also useful from other rooms. Its been reliable for years now.

title: Great app
comment: Really enjoying this wish there was a xfce connect to but love it saw far only complaint I have so far is the keyboard support is iffy at best very hit or miss (love the hacker keyboard support but I have been using The google keyboard in PC mode lately)

title: Great app! Missing some features though...
comment: Works great with my S3 Mini running CM11, there are some missing features though: 1. Cannot change Remote Control touchpad speed from inside the app. 2. Bringing up the phone's keyboard via the keyboard button in the Remote Control section does not actually allow you to type on the computer (I've tried using the AOSP, Swiftkey and Hacker's keyboard, though it could be a problem with my particular rom). 3. No way to change the Save Path in Share Receiver on the phone side. 4. While you do get notified about incoming messages, you can't really do anything with them from the computer. The program settings in KDE say that SMS answering is coming soon, but I really hope the dev goes beyond that and adds functionality to manage and send messages the way one does with an IM client.  Combine those features with lots of tweakable options and some material design and I'll even throw money at you.

title: Great
comment: I like this app, but I think you should create a new design. And maybe, upgrade to lollipop? Expect that little default, everything works like a charm. Actually, it even reminds me of apple iOS and osx integration. Btw, sorry for bad English :)

title: Wow!
comment: I've had numerous problems with connectivity with this phone. The wired connection via mtp: has never worked, and wifi apps have been at best clunky and awkward to set up. This Just Works™, and does so much more, too!

title: Getting better and better
comment: Works great !!

title: Great app
comment: Connecting via usb would be awesome, but even without it this is a must have.

title: Best desktop integration apps on android
comment: KDE Connect is simply the best app to integrate android and desktop. It offers many features that most others lack. It always works flawlessly and perfectly. I will give it a million stars if I can. As for other users who can't get some features working, you need to upgrade KDE Connect on your desktop to the lastest version to use them. The lastest version isn't included in Kubuntu's repo but you can use deb package or ppa.

title: Amazing. Even for Gnome desktops
comment: This app is one of the best in the store. Initially just installed it for easy file transfer without pushbullet, but now use it.for everything. Transfers, mouse, music n video remote. With ubuntu Gnome 3.14 and 2 handhelds and a tablet. All works perfect. Great job on this. Brilliant.

title: Just perfect
comment: This one just works. I don't need to connect it when I come home. It just works perfectly. One of the best things for KDE

title: Surprisingly awesome
comment: Lots of unpretentious "just works" integration with desktop app.  My new favourite piece of software.
works like a charm with Linux Mint 17 KDE

title: Perfect integration!
comment: With KaOS on my desktop counterpart it's just the best app ever. Love the music pausing on calls and remote control stuff. Long live KDE! ;)

title: Very useful
comment: If you use Linux, then this is a must have app for integrating your computer and phone. It works with my blackberry Z10 too
Sweet, /me like!
Exceptional application!
Great App and getting better.
Very useful

title: Fantastic!
comment: When I first installed KDE Connect, I didn't really think I'd even want it in the long run. It just seemed too much of a gimmick. After I received the first SMS text on my PC, I became hooked. Sending images, websites, etc. to my PC is almost seamless. Simply copying an URL to the clipboard on my PC and pasting it on my smartphone is so much easier than tab syncing or scanning stupid on-screen QR codes. 5 stars!

title: Great app!
comment: I love getting notifications on my desktop and being able to push files to and from the phone
Awesome

title: Great app, need faster desktop updates
comment: As a Kubuntu user this is a really useful tool, but my problem is that updates for the desktop component take ages to work through to the repositories. How about a PPA dedicated to making the latest build available? I really don't want to have to build from source for my desktops.

title: For unity?
comment: Is there an alternative of this for unity ?

title: Very useful
comment: This app is great. It is useful for connecting Android to PC, or Android to Android. I can quickly send files from my N6 to my N7. Keep up the great work.   You might want to add in the description, from the KDE website: "If you are behind a firewall, make sure to open the port range 1714-1764 for both TCP and UDP."  I was ok on my router, but had to open these ports on my PC to my Android device IPs.

title: Epic
comment: This is essential feature of modern desktop

title: Nice work by kde
comment: I'm using KDE from 2009. A nice graphical env provided be KDE team in GNU/Linux. Now a nice integration between gadgets and PC . hope this tool is getting updated. A small suggestion to KDE. Please release a mobile operating system with KDE as UI.
I love it! :D

title: Probably the most useful app ever
comment: All features worked out of the box. File transfers between my laptop and my phone have always been cumbersome because my laptop does not have built-in Bluetooth. This app makes it easier then ever. Clipboard synchronization is just amazing. Gone are the days when I would type links by hand into my phone that I have opened on my computer. As I said: an amazing app!

title: Awesome
comment: Potential to more features but very usefully.

title: awesome app
comment: would like the ability to adjust cursor speed since i have to drag my fingers a lot to move the cursor trough the screen

title: Wow!
comment: Just wow...

Toll. Maus und Tastatur des PCs mit dem Android kontrollieren. VLC und Clementine vom Sofa aus bedienen beim Film schauen oder Musik hören. Browser geht für mich auch mit Zugriff externer Karte (wegen root?). Besser wäre noch eine Integration der App Clementine remote und dass man Tastatur/Maus von PC für Android nutzen kann. Aber trotzdem schon genial. Funzt alles ohne KDE, benutze Ubuntu mit Unity. Danke!
Great app, makes me appreciate KDE even more. Please add support for Qmmp music player and make the Touchpad plugin work..

title: Works great (the answer to desktop integration)but needs some improvements
comment: This app is the answer to all linux/android connection issues. It is very stable and simple and useful. I'd like to see a few features added like 1.Disconnect a device on the same network (shows up on my indicator that coworker is running the app on his phone, so far no way to remove that indicator in ubuntu 14.04) 2. navigation arrows with the touchpad function, for like xbmc(kodi) or a libreoffice presentation.  3. Ability to reply from the kde indicator (that would be the bomb!!) Other than that, I think it's one of the best answers to "true integration" of phone and desktop.  Flawless on Kubuntu 14.04, even wowed my wife when she was watching a video and it paused the video for her incoming phone call. That is unbelievable.  Well Done Albert!

title: This is great!!
comment: I can leave my phone on silent and see who's calling on my desktop (Kubuntu 14.10. Perfect for the library. 👍

title: Handy integration
comment: This app becomes a tool I use everyday. Most time invisible, it shows up when you need it. Nicely done.

title: What's done so far is great
comment: It would be really, really nice, though, if kdeconnect could act as an Android keyboard too. It's great to be able to use my phone as a trackpad, but there are some phone-only apps like WhatsApp that it would be nice to be able to use a proper keyboard to type into. It seems like kdeconnect has all the PC <-> phone connectivity sorted, so this could be the ideal app to implement such a feature! 5 stars already, and if you implement the keyboard suggestion it would be worth a sixth!

title: Works great
comment: I love quickly sending files to my laptop. Seeing SMS messages on my laptop is great too.

title: Just not working
comment: Great idea, but doesn't work. Devices don't show up on each other. Motorola Moto G, Android 4.4.4., Ubuntu 14.04, KDE 4.14.2. Tried Ubuntu packages, also PPA packages. Tried allowing ports in firewall as per website howto, adding IPs, checked processes running etc. Wasted over 2 hours, just don't have any more time for fiddling with this. Equivalent software for Apple, Windows, from Motorola etc Just Works (TM). This, disappointingly, doesn't :-(

title: Splendid App
comment: It works awesome in openSUSE 13.2. Plus, the media control & cursor control is superdope. KDE is best, period!

title: Great!
comment: Works a treat on 14.04! Thx

title: Awesome app.
comment: I've needed something like Unified Remote for my Kubuntu set up. Works great, connects easily, can't wait to see which features come next. Great work. Would be nice if there was like a quick-terminal/shell interface to send commands though... (Edit: Touchpad not working on Kubuntu 14.04, also doesn't work at all with Kodi)

title: music -> phone -> music !
comment: My favourite thing : when someone calls me, Amarok stops playing.  even when i unplug the phone, even if i'm in another room, my playlist is paused.  As soon as i hang up, the music starts again.  lovely. I also really like that i can have the phone charging from the wall or another computer but still access it from my main desktop.  It'll be great when i can write a txt without leaving my keyboard. I haven't used all the features, but I like the ones i do use, and i like the future plans.   thanks Albert and friends!

title: Must have!!
comment: Thank you for making this possible. Everything seems to work just fine and was easy to setup. Both my laptop and desktop can interact with my phone. I love it!!!

title: Just not working :(
comment: It's not working at all for me.  On Kubuntu 14.04 and a Moto X (2013).  The computer isn't showing up on the app, and the phone isn't showing up on the desktop app.  Both on same WiFi network.  I've tried manually entering the IP address in the phone app but still nothing.  So disappointing!!!  Can't find troubleshooting information online.   A fantastic idea and from what I can see, a great app for most people so I hate giving such a low review but I have to be honest.

title: A surprise
comment: I knew about KDE-Connect, but just tried it out. It is very smooth and friendly, very useful if you work ours in front of your computer. Bidirectional audio and the possibility to answer/make calls or maybe reply to sms/Whatsapp would really be a great addition!

title: Excellent
comment: Most useful bit of software, starting to rely on it.

title: This makes it so easy...
comment: To connect to your KDE desktop and transfer files. I also love the notifications. It tells you exactly who's calling and will mute the sound for you and continue playing all on its own! Fyi to all the people having trouble, you have to use the 3rd party repository that way both applications will be synced. If you are using Kubuntu, from the terminal, type> sudo add-app-repository ppa:vikoadi/ppa. From Muon package manager, edit your sources list and add the "ppa:vikoadi/ppa" w/o quotes. Update: The notifications seem like they are not working my note 2, works on my wifes s3. Using ppa.

title: Great
comment: Using it mostly to share files, receive phone calls (never hear my phone) and control media.

title: Excellent

title: Cool and useful!
comment: Great integration with KDE! Lightning fast file transfer! Now, when I want to watch a movie on the tablet, instead of painfully browsing the server using the SMB support of ES File Explorer, I select the file in seconds using the computer and push it to the tablet, at 5 times the speed. Awesome. Thanks! :)  If I miss something I guess it would be file transfer progress indication.

title: KDE 4.14 makes this AWESOME
comment: I can finally click and browse my phone, share a URL to my desktop, and see all my notifications without looking at my phone.

title: Connect via USB
comment: Wonderful app. Great idea. What prevents me from giving you the last star, is the lack of USB connection. Most of the time I sit at the library, or other public areas where connection over wifi isn't possible due to very strict rules. And I am also charging my phone from the computers USB port.

title: Totally amazing!
comment: The little moment when I answered the phone and the music on my laptop stopped was magical. "Hello? Oh my God!! Have you seen what KDE just did? Oh no of course, you're not here. But it was amazing."

title: Love at first sight
comment: I always loved KDE, and now that I've seen how well Android integrates with it thanks to KDE Connect I will never leave them. An interesting idea would be a lock screen widget.

title: KDE is amazing
comment: Never before have I found a feature so unparalleled on any other desktop.  This is why I run KDE, for amazing software like this.

title: Amazing app!!

title: Excellent idea
comment: Love being able to cut and paste between phone and computer.

title: Nice
comment: Needs smplayer support

title: Fantastic app, thank you!
comment: Wonderful integration of your Android device with your KDE desktop! File and URL sharing, shared clipboard content, multimedia control, call and SMS notification, all very useful features.  You need to install the accompanying *kdeconnect* package on KDE (if not installed already).  When paired, you can configure the available plugins and paired devices on your KDE desktop: Settings > System Settings > KDE Connect (under Hardware).

title: Wireless freedom!
comment: Definitely the best and easiest to use if you are using KDE. The only file accessing app that works properly without root or dodgy browser support.

title: Great!
comment: And getting better with every update. Keep up good work

title: Handy, but Some Issues
comment: I really like being able to see all my notifications (although being able to reply to text messages on the desktop would be really nice too), but unfortunately the remote control doesn't seem to work at all for me. Currently using Kubuntu 14.04 with latest KDE Connect.

The KDE Connect version in Kubuntu doesn't update as fast as the application in the Play Store, and some features are still not present. If you want to always have the latest version, in the description you will find an up-to-date repo for (K)Ubuntu.

title: Awesome app
comment: First of all, all those people who say that something doesn't work - UPDATE kdeconnect on PC. Standard repositories often contain old versions, so the app should be compiled from source. Perfectly for the version of PC app to be the same of the one of the Android app. Second, I really love this app. It makes any interaction with the phone much, much easier. As said earlier - true power of linux.

title: Really awesome, but it has its flaws...
comment: Clipboard sync has a very annoying character limit (or is this a bug) that I can't understand the purpose of, and the mouse control doesn't work at all. I wasn't able to get the battery percentage showing either, but I have a desktop, not a laptop, and my battery indicator widget keeps saying "no battery installed". I'm assuming that if my PC did have a battery, this feature would work right. Maybe you could work in a workaround of some sort?  I'm very excited for this app. If nothing else, I will be using it for sharing URLs to my PC.

title: Works Great!
comment: *Update* Having lots of trouble connecting and staying connected trying to transfer short videos is not working at all. I upgraded my Plasmoid on Kubuntu 14.04 to 7.1 and I had to also allow the program through my firewall and configure my router port forwarding in order for the phone to see the connection the ports are 1714 through 1764  it is now working correcttly file share works both ways the touchpad controls my desktop the only thing I can't get working is sharing url from my desktop to phone there is no right click option for that. I am also not certain how the shared clip board works as there are no instructions.  A

title: A must have for any KDE user
comment: This is an excellent proof of concept of what convergence can do. However, it's still a little unpolished on my HTC M8 where Google hangouts will notify me on the desktop with a generic notification instead of the contents of the text message. I suspect this is an issue more with hangouts, but would love to see it addressed in an update. Great work!

title: Getting there...
comment: On an Alps (Kogan) Agora HD+  Android 4.2.1  Works: -Battery monitor - except it does not display the % icon; instead it requires the user to click on it to gett that info, which is not ideal. -Shared clipboard -Media control receiver -Ping -Pause media during calls. -Telephony integratyion - report incoming call -Share and receive - send files from phone to PC works as expected, but I do not see how to send files from PC to phone.  Does not work: -Mouse touchpad is available but does not move mouse or click buttons. -Notification sync does not report email received in gmail app. Nor anyhting else I tried.  Untested: -Share and receive - share URLs or plain text works via clipboard plugin, but I do not see how it works under this plugin. There is no context menu for sending files in Kubuntu 14.04 -Telephony integratyion - report incoming SMS

title: Excellent work!
comment: Nexus 5 device communicates nicely with desktop (Kubuntu Trusty beta 2).  I was really impressed with the forethought.  For example, the app mutes Amarok while an incoming phonecall is in route.  No need to run to the computer and dive to hit the "mute" button because the music is too loud to take the call.  One minor suggestion is to integrate more data into the media controls.  So, for example, a little bar at the top with the album art, artist and song info, and especially: a progress bar.  It would be nice to fast-forward/rewind the song by moving a status indicator along the progress bar, like in Youtube for example.

title: Good job!
comment: Currently using it in three different phones with my laptop and my desktop (Kubuntu both) and it works beautifully. Notification and clipboard sync is really handy. If I have to name something I don't like, that would be when the phone battery is about to die: it generates a lot of new notifications on your pc (I don't know if KDE allows notification reuse or auto-dismissal, so there might be nothing to do about this).

title: Dead easy setup
comment: I was blpwn away by how remarkably easy it was to pair my Ubuntu 12.04 laptop with my Zareason ZT2 tablet. I can now control my computer from my tablet as long as they are on the same wireless network. This is nothing short of astounding. Hopefully, keyboard controls will come soon. Imagine using this as a presentation device!
